bond.spypoint

Annotation Type SpyPoint


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface SpyPoint

    An annotation used to specify that a method should be spied on by Bond. Placing this annotation will result in Bond placing a call to Bond.spy(java.lang.String) whenever the method is called; for example:

    
   public class MyClass {
     @SpyPoint
     public int myMethod(int myArg, String mySecondArg) {
       // your code here
     }
   }

    The above code will cause every call to myMethod() to result in a call to:

    Bond.obs("arg0[int]", myArg, "arg1[String]", mySecondArg).spy("MyClass.myMethod")

    Unfortunately, in Java 7, parameter names are not available at runtime, so arg0, arg1, ... are used instead. In Java 8, for code compiled with the -parameters flag, the actual names will be used instead.

    In addition to this, if the call to spy returns a value (through the use of SpyAgent.withResult(java.lang.Object)), that value will be returned instead of calling the actual method. This can be useful to mock out certain methods during testing. If the method you want to mock normally returns void, just have the SpyAgent return any value, and this will mark the method as mocked.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static String DEFAULT_POINT_NAME 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean mockOnly
      If true: this spy point will be "mocking-only", meaning calls to this spy point will not be recorded as observations; all other agent actions will still apply.
      boolean requireAgentResult
      If true: require that an agent with a return value is used to mock out this method during testing.
      String spyPointName
      The name to use for this spy point.
      boolean spyResult
      If true: in addition to spying the arguments to the method being spied on, spy the return value.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_POINT_NAME

        public static final String DEFAULT_POINT_NAME

    • Element Detail

      • spyPointName

        public abstract String spyPointName
        The name to use for this spy point. Defaults to ClassName.methodName.
        Returns:
        the name of this spy point
        Default:
        "BOND_SPY_DEFAULT_POINT_NAME"

      • spyResult

        public abstract boolean spyResult
        If true: in addition to spying the arguments to the method being spied on, spy the return value. This still applies even if the return value is mocked. This option is ignored if the return type of the spied method is void.
        Returns:
        whether or not to spy the result of the spied method
        Default:
        false

      • requireAgentResult

        public abstract boolean requireAgentResult
        If true: require that an agent with a return value is used to mock out this method during testing. This is useful if you have some dangerous method that should never be called during testing.
        Returns:
        whether or not mocking is required for this spy point
        Default:
        false

      • mockOnly

        public abstract boolean mockOnly
        If true: this spy point will be "mocking-only", meaning calls to this spy point will not be recorded as observations; all other agent actions will still apply. This can be useful if you want to mock a method but are not interested in the order of calls to that method, e.g. a method that generates a random string.
        Returns:
        whether or not this spy point is mocking-only.
        Default:
        false
